intro: Habrothamnus fasciculatus, commonly known as the clustered flax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes sedges and buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate and have a distinctive blue-green color with a waxy coating. Habrothamnus fasciculatus is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
